headings.text: H1. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage
H2. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage
H3. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage
H4. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage
H5. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage
H6. A heading is a word, phrase, or sentence at the beginning of a written passage

fontFormating.text: Bolds weight makes letters of a text thicker than the surrounding text.
Italics are used primarily to denote titles and names of particular works or objects
Represents text <mark>which is marked or highlighted</mark> for reference or notation purposes.
Represents <small>side-comments and small print</small>, like copyright and legal text, independent of its styled presentation.
Represents a range of text that <del>has been deleted</del> from a document.
Represents a range of text that <ins>has been added</ins> to a document.
Specifies inline text which <sub>should be displayed as subscript</sub> for solely typographical reasons.
Specifies inline text which is to be <sup>displayed as superscript</sup> for solely typographical reasons.
